newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Thai Airways plans Stockholm-Bangkok cargo flights.
newsitem.headline: Thai Airways plans Stockholm-Bangkok cargo flights.

text.p: Thai Airways International Ltd's cargo division said on Thursday it plans a freighter service from August 5 through Paris, Dubai, Stockholm and Osaka.
Peter Sull, cargo and mail sales manager for Scandinavia and Finland, told Reuters the Boeing 747-200 freighter would be leased from Atlas Air and would carry Thai Airways' colours.

It would fly from Bangkok to Dubai and Paris before stopping in Stockholm once weekly. The aircraft would depart Stockholm for Bangkok via Dubai. The same aircraft would then continue on to Osaka, Sull said.
"We haven't announced it yet because it's still pending an air traffic agreement between Sweden and the United Arab Emirates," Sull said, but added that was just a matter of paperwork.
Thai Airways was also waiting for full traffic rights from France's Charles de Gaulle airport to Stockholm's Arlanda, he added.
